intro: Triceras oxyceras, commonly known as the sharp-lobed triceras, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Triceras oxyceras is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks in its native habitat.
